text.p: Singapore Technologies Shipbuilding & Engineering Ltd said on Wednesday orders it had already received should keep it busy in 1997.

The company said in a statement issued with its 1996 financial results that its engineering business was expected to do better this year while its ship-repair sales were expected to be maintained at current levels.
"The major contracts-in-hand for the construction of the remaining six patrol vessels and four 140m Landing Ship Tanks will keep the company busy," it said.
The company reported a 13 percent rise in net profit to Singapore $43.27 million. Turnover rose to S$349.96 million, up from S$219.64 million in 1995.
It said the higher turnover was due mainly to increased shipbuilding activity.
On December 31, 1996, the company had net assets of S$205.24 million, up from S$168.23 million a year earlier.
